page.title: 13Local History
page.content: Settlement consists of scattered farms most of which have existed on the same site for at least 300 years,for example Hagge Farm,which is an impressive 3 storey stone building, was once a hunting lodge.Ince Barn is mentioned in the original Domesday Book.The cottages named after it ,and still marked on the O.S. map,have been demolished recently.Park House Farm was once a coaching inn and there is still a public bridleway running past the farm linking the villages in the block.The land at one time belonged to three families the Frechevilles,the Sitwells and the de Rhodes.Slitting Mill Farm is on the site of a nail manufacturing mill dating back to Tudor times.
